title: Nobility17
author: Nobility17
content: I have been following the trending story of Brazilian footballer's involvement in alleged sexual assault. with no disrespect, we all know that with the level of fame attached to football as a career one can get any class of woman, local and international. It now brings about the question why then do they get involved in such act? I know we all have individual differences, morally, mentally, socially, and otherwise. But exposure should teach us what's morally wrong or right. The case of Dani Alves, the most decorated men's footballer now takes a wrong twist in history, as he's been sentenced to 18years  in jail for Rape.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: You said, Brazil. I don't know much about Brazil. But if the riots about election fraud are any example of the Brazilian legal system, maybe Dani Alves wasn't guilty, but was set up.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: I don’t think it’s much to do with fame. Unfortunately some people are just awful human beings. There are sex offenders everywhere. It doesn’t matter if it’s a footballer, a music star or a mail man. There are sadly just bad people in many parts of life.I hope victims of any crimes like this can recover physically & mentally. I hope the offenders get suitable jail time & karma gets them.

comments.author: Dariona
comments.body: I also love football and often supported Brazil. All the scandals knocked me out of the koliya. I'm honestly shocked that this could happen. And there are a lot of such cases in football lately.
